bibliography:
Albert, D. Z., 1986, “How to Take a Photograph of Another
Everett World”, Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences:
New Techniques and Ideas in Quantum Measurement Theory, 480:
498–502.

–––, 1992, Quantum Mechanics and Experience,
Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press.

Albert, D. Z., and J. A. Barrett: 1995, “On What It Takes To
Be a World”, Topoi, 14: 35–37.

Albert, D. Z., and B. Loewer, 1988, “Interpreting the Many
Worlds Interpretation”, Synthese, 77:
195–213.

Bacciagaluppi, G., 2002, “Remarks on Space-time and Locality
in Everett’s Interpretation”, in T. Placek and J.
Butterfield (eds),Non-Locality and Modality, Dordrecht:
Kluwer Academic, pp. 105–122.
 [Preprint available online].

Barrett, J., 1994, “The Suggestive Properties of Quantum
Mechanics Without the Collapse Postulate”, Erkenntnis,
41: 233–252.

–––, 1995, “The Single-Mind and Many-Minds
Formulations of Quantum Mechanics”, Erkenntnis, 42:

–––, 1996, “Empirical Adequacy and the Availability

–––, 1999, The Quantum Mechanics of Minds and
Worlds, Oxford: Oxford University Press.

–––, 2000, “The Nature of Measurement Records in

–––, 2005 “Relativistic Quantum Mechanics Through
Frame-Dependent Constructions,” Philosophy of Science
72: 802–813.

–––, 2010, “A Structural Interpretation of Pure Wave

–––, 2011a, “On the Faithful Interpretation of Pure

–––, 2011b, “Everett’s Pure Wave Mechanics and
the Notion of Worlds”, European Journal for Philosophy of

–––, 2017, “Typical Worlds,” Studies in
the History and Philosophy of Modern Physics, 58: 31-40.

Barrett, J. and P. Byrne (eds.), 2012, The Everett

Bell, J. S., 1987, Speakable and Unspeakable in Quantum

Bub, J., R. Clifton and B. Monton, 1998, “The Bare Theory

113–158.

–––, 2001, “Some Worlds of Quantum
Theory”, in R. Russell, J. Polkinghorne et al. (eds.),

Byrne, P., 2007, “The Many Worlds of Hugh Everett”.

–––, 2010, The Many Worlds of Hugh Everett III: Multiple

Clifton, R., 1996, “On What Being a World Takes Away”,

Conroy, C., 2012, “The Relative Facts Interpretation and

DeWitt, B. S., 1970, “Quantum Mechanics and Reality”.

–––, 1971, “The Many-Universes Interpretation of

DeWitt, B. S., and N. Graham (eds.), 1973, The Many-Worlds

Dowker, F., and A. Kent, 1996, “On the Consistent Histories

Everett, H., 1956, “The Theory of the Universal Wave
Function”. First printed in DeWitt and Graham (1973),
3–140. Reprinted as cited here in Barrett and Byrne (2012)
72–172.

–––, 1957a, On the Foundations of Quantum
Mechanics, Ph.D. thesis, Princeton University, Department of
Physics. See Everett (1957b).

–––, 1957b, “‘Relative State’
Formulation of Quantum Mechanics”, Reviews of Modern
Physics, 29: 454–462. This article closely follows Everett
(1957a). The version cited here as Everett (1957) is presented in
Barrett and Byrne (2012, 174–196) and incorporates both Everett
(1957a) and (1957b) with commentary.

Gell-Mann, M., and J. B. Hartle, 1990, “Quantum Mechanics in

Hemmo, M., and I. Pitowsky, 2003, “Probability and

Werner, F. G., 1962, The transcript of the Conference on the
Foundations of Quantum Mechanics held at Xavier University
Physics Department 1–5 October 1962. Comments of the
participants were transcribed by F. G. Werner, and the participants
apparently had the opportunity to make corrections to the Werner
typescript. Published on CD by Xavier University, 2002.

Wheeler, J. A., and W. H. Zurek (eds.), 1983, Quantum Theory
and Measurement, Princeton: Princeton University Press.

Zurek, W. H., 1991, “Decoherence and the Transition from
